intro: Centaurium latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Centaurium latifolium is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
